website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty feeder can be freestanding or fixed to a tree.
pros: All-in-one solution – timer, drum, and thrower mechanism
6 feeds a day at up to 99 seconds each
Timer screen has useful battery life indicator
Can also be used as a fish feeder
cons: Lid can be awkward to remove and replace
Care needed to avoid water getting in

customer_reviews.title: By far the best on the market
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what everyone it bitching about I have two of the 55 gallon feeders which hold 250 lbs corn which run all year long with a 20amp hour deep cycle battery I never have to charge it just put another battery in it after a year so it’s full charged I have three batteries two that stay on feeders and one on stand by spoked to Jeff these by far are the best feeders ever and believe me I know I had lots of them thanks for the great product Jeff Tom
customer_reviews.author: Thomas y.

customer_reviews.title: So i have bought many feeders thru the years. ...
customer_reviews.text: So i have bought many feeders thru the years. Most all were lucky to survive a year on my bear infested farm. After 2 years i can say this feeder is truly one & done it is bullet proof . One simple modification i made was a solar charger.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Woods

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: After the third time of filling this feeder the top WILL NOT SEAL! After calling the company and they told me how to fix the problem it still doesn't fix it. One & I'm done! Won't be buying another one for sure! Waste of time and money...
customer_reviews.author: McCord

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but could be sealed better
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work. After a few weeks went to refill and a lot of corn dust in the motor compartment even though put caulk around steel baffle under the corn layer. Second one I sealed as best I could reach the metal junction above the motor compartment as well. We’ll see. Is sturdy and not damaged by animals yet. Also need to be careful about top gasket after filling or water gets in and rots contents
customer_reviews.author: mark torke

customer_reviews.title: Great for feeding your fish
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money only fill once a month this is for feeding my fish three times a day thanks
customer_reviews.author: David G. Capps

customer_reviews.title: The only bear proof feeder on the market
customer_reviews.text: I struggle with bears in my area. I have tried hanging them from trees with a heavy winch, putting electric fence around them, and nothing seemed to work until I found these guys. I mount the barrels to a tree with a 5/16 inch chain around the bracket and then loop it around the foot to keep them from twisting it sideways. I have had numerous 400+ bears try to get into this thing and other than laving claw marks, teeth marks and slightly twisting it on the tree, the feeders were completely unharmed and continued to function. I highly recommend these feeders they are well worth the money...
customer_reviews.author: greg kesner

customer_reviews.title: Its heavy secure well
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a fish feeder and absolutely love it works perfectly.....
customer_reviews.author: bobby thomas

customer_reviews.title: varmint proof
customer_reviews.text: I have other feeders with accessories to prevent damage from varmints (leg funnels, wire varmint cage around motor/spinner) that are still vulnerable to varmints. Two different major brands that are made of plastic type materials that squirrels and raccoons eat holes in their feed barrels and wires leading from solar panels - One and Done eliminated any and all varmint issues as delivered without any accessories!
customer_reviews.author: John Ulam

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this feeder for 4 months now. We were having problems with raccoons and squirrels chewing our plastic feeders. This feeder eliminated the problem. It has worked flawlessly and the battery lasted 3 months. I would highly recommend this product. It is simple to use, easy to hang, and indestructible. Spend the extra money and buy a feeder that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph A Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works good the only problem is the lid it's a rain catcher so I made a little roof for it hopefully the bear don't break it off
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Minimal Bear Damage
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these feeders and love it. I hunt on a club that borders the Okefenokee Swamp Refuge here in Southeast Georgia. We have a lot of hogs and black bear here as well as whitetail. The bears have tried their best to get into the feeder, but the worst they have been able to do is pull about half of the rain guard loose above the feed slot and bend down the thin plates on the bottom of the feet. Thanks for a great product. I've definitely found my one and done!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using as a fish feeder
customer_reviews.text: Not too complicated to assemble but ZERO instructions came with delivery. They say look online at utube videos but the only thing u find is promotional videos. Very sturdy and so far working as advertised. Inner funnel doesn’t fit very well and had to seal it in with tape to prevent grain dust from filtering into motor/battery compartment
customer_reviews.author: Richard P.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Works very well so far, only thing i don't like is the hanging bracket could be a little more heavy duty. I have bears and worried its not strong enough. If not for the bracket i would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: James C Nash

customer_reviews.title: Better than big box store feeders
customer_reviews.text: Great feeder and well built. Dry inside and throws well. I did replace the timer as it got wet but not due to any fault of the design. Just be sure to put the timer on top the battery if you place directly on the ground to avoid storm water that may run through.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy j. Crochet Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and works great. I had to tighten the spinner plate but not a big deal. Things get loose in shipment. Several pics of bears with no damage to the feeder. Real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jim O.

customer_reviews.title: The product is really close to being a great solution.
customer_reviews.text: Concept is really good, and I think they are really close to a 5 star product. Bought because product was cheaper than other products but better set up than those that cost less. Had to make alterations to the feeder to keep food from dropping to battery and spinner area. Customer service was responsive to my needs and responded in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hersh

customer_reviews.title: Best feeder on the market
customer_reviews.text: Got the 130lb feeder, here in upstate S.C. we have a lot of black bears some 400-500 lbs. Mounted to a old telephone post the bears wrestled the feeder the first 2 weeks even standing on top of it. It is built well follow the directions and all should go well, check the feed and the battery every few weeks and you will love it. Planning on getting a another this coming spring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very easy to set up and program. I have had zero problems. I added a small solar charger to battery just to be safe. Shipped quickly as well. I will be buying another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I set it up in my yard to test it out. It took about ten minutes to set up. It slings corn out about 20 yards from the feeder and at that point the area of coverage is about 20 yards wide. I'm taking it to the woods next weekend. I'll find out if it is truly bear proof.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Kicklighter

customer_reviews.title: The ABSOLUTE BEST Feeder
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a lot of feeders in my life and I can tell you this is the best feeder I have ever spent money on, EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to fill from ground level.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first 5 in January and they worked good, so I ordered 5 more. I use them for deer and fish feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Grant

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I LIKE HAVING THE ABILITY TO STRAP TO A TREE OUT OF THE REACH OF HOGS
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Caskey

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to put out by my deer shack set it up at the edge of the woods behind my house to test it. My wife and I liked it there feeding the mixed animals so much I did not move it we watch the deer, squirrel and turkey from our screened in porch. I will by another one for where I hunt later. It’s built well does what it says it will do, great how to videos from the manufacturer. It’s really idiot proof.
customer_reviews.author: Koke

customer_reviews.title: Great game feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these to feed Aoudad goats and even though there were many cattle in the area, they simply could not mess this feeder up, despite their best efforts. This is the best feeder you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I own the 55 gallon unit and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I own the 55 gallon unit and I love it!! I have a bear problem and so far this feeder has won the battle. Unit works very well. I find it hard to believe anything negative on this unit? It works and works well!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Reed

customer_reviews.title: Holds 2 50lb bags of corn,great feeder for trying out new locations. Very durable, yet not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deer feeder. I definitely like it better than all the feeders with the kicker on the bottom, regardless how high above the ground it may be. This feeder has a very powerful motor and slings corn with authority! The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because with use, the battery/controller compartment is filled with dust from the corn. To a large degree. However, this does not affect the performance of the feeder, you just have to clean off the controller any time you go to reprogram or change the settings. That is the only downside and it will not keep me from purchasing more in the future!

customer_reviews.title: Definitely One and Done...
customer_reviews.text: I should have taken the name of this company more literally. Instead I decided to buy two of these feeders. Both of them are 3 seasons old and have been riddled with problems. For starters they are not resistant to weather. I have hung my feeders in every way possible, they still eventually get water inside that will damage the poorly designed controller and motor. I have replaced motors, controllers, feeder wheels, just about everything you can think of to keep these running. The paint will rot off by year two and the feeders will eventually rust out. I've had a $90 plastic wal-mart feeder that is 10 years old and runs circles around these units!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, direct purchase from One & Done
customer_reviews.text: I'm posting this on Amazon since one & done doesn't put negative post on their website. I received a 55 gal feeder believing it would distribute corn as advertised, this is false !! I measured the distance and only one single kernel made it to 34 feet and the majority were out to 23 feet. This is very disappointing and far from what they advertise
customer_reviews.author: lowerbama

customer_reviews.title: Not what it’s cracked up to be.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, worked good for a week and then the timer went out. Spoke to the owner and he sent me a new one. Well that time my brand new batteries died within a week. The timer went out again, so I bought my own one. Now the feeder leaks water somewhere. Not what it’s cracked up to be.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Hayes

product_meta.title: One and Done Game Feeder - Built to Last - Loads 130lbs or 250 lbs (30 Gallon Scout Game Feeder)
feature_bullets: No assembly or tools necessary, can be setup anywhere by anyone. The OAD feeder can be placed on the ground, strapped to a tree (bracket included), or on a traditional tripod.
Multi-patented directional feeder allows for the most accurate throw and calculation of how long the feed will last.

30-gallon drum holds up to 130 lbs. 1 cup of feed covers the widest field range in the industry which saves you time and money. Works with any dry feed .125” to .50” in diameter (corn, protein, pellets, fish food, etc).

Smart Program TM digital timer allows you to schedule up to 6 feedings a day. Customize feed dispense time between 1-99 seconds. Can operate on as little as one 12-volt battery (not included) or up to as much as a car battery. No need for solar power.
NOT recommended for areas with a heavy bear population. While this feeder is bear resistant, it is not bear proof like the 55 gallon model which is better suited for those areas.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars45 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
